Furlanijo Julijsko krajino prizadela neurja
04 Nov 2019, 12:14 by STA

V Furlaniji Julijski krajini (FJK) so ponoči divjala huda neurja z obilnim dežjem. Na območjih Vidma in Trsta je močan veter podrl več sto dreves, iz pokrajin Videm in Pordenone poročajo o izpadih električnega toka, poročajo lokalni mediji. Neurja od nedelje divjajo tudi v nekaterih drugih italijanskih deželah.



Fotografija je simbolična. Foto: pixabay.com

VIDEM > Iz FJK poročajo o močnem vetru. Na gori Rest v Karnijskih Alpah so zabeležili sunke vetra s hitrostjo 123 kilometrov na uro. V goratih predelih je padlo tudi veliko dežja, malo manj v nižinah, na svoji spletni strani piše časnik Il Messagero Veneto.
Reka Tilment je zaradi obilnih padavin močno narasla. V Vidmu se je sprožilo več manjših zemeljskih plazov, zaradi katerih je zaprtih več cest. O večji škodi poročajo iz Tolmeča, kjer je v nedeljo do večera padlo 135 litrov dežja na kvadratni meter.
Slabo vreme in močan veter je v tej italijanski zvezni deželi po napovedih vremenoslovcev pričakovati tudi v prihodnjih dneh.
O neurjih in poplavah od nedelje poročajo tudi iz dežel Ligurija, Piemont, Trentinsko - Zgornje Poadižje in Benečija.
V Liguriji je od nedelje do davi ob 8. uri zaradi visokih valov in močnega vetra veljalo rdeče opozorilo pred neurji. V tej deželi o večji škodi poročajo iz letoviškega mesta Lavagna blizu Genove, ki ga je prizadel tornado. Veter je odkrival strehe hiš in podiral drevesa.
V Genovi so po poročanju italijanske tiskovne agencije Ansa danes do preklica zaradi slabega vremena zaprti vsi dostopi do morja in na pečine. Oblasti prebivalce pozivajo, naj bodo previdni pri približevanju obali ter pri hoji in vožnji po obalnih cestah.
Fronta slabega vetra se je zatem pomaknila proti jugu. V pokrajini Pisa so morali v nedeljo zaradi poplav in manjših zemeljskih plazov večkrat posredovati gasilci. O obilnih padavinah so poročali tudi iz Rima.

The Friuli Venezia Giulia is hit by storms
04 Nov 2019, 12:14 by STA

In Friuli Venezia Giulia (FJK), heavy storms rained at night with heavy rain. Huge winds have blown hundreds of trees in the areas of Udine and Trieste, and power outages are reported from the provinces of Udine and Pordenone, local media reported. Sunday storms are raging in some other Italian countries as well.



Photography is symbolic. Photo credit: pixabay.com

I SEE> FJC reports strong wind. Wind gusts of 123 kilometers per hour were recorded at Rest Mountain in the Carnic Alps. Much rain has also fallen in the highlands, a little less in the lowlands, Il Messagero Veneto writes on its website.
The Tilment River has grown sharply due to heavy rainfall. Several landslides have been triggered in Udine, which has closed several roads. Major damage was reported from Tolmeč, where 135 liters of rain per square meter fell Sunday to evening.
Bad weather and strong wind are expected in this Italian state in the coming days as well.
Storms and floods have also been reported Sunday from the Liguria, Piedmont, Trentino-Upper Carniola and Veneto regions.
In Liguria, a red storm warning was issued from 8am on Sunday until dawn at 8am because of high waves and strong wind. More damage has been reported in this land from the resort town of Lavagna near Genoa, which was hit by a tornado. The wind was discovering the roofs of houses and tearing down trees.
According to the Italian news agency Ansa, all access to the sea and to the cliffs has been closed today in Genoa, until canceled due to bad weather. Authorities urge residents to be careful when approaching the coast and when walking and driving along coastal roads.
The low wind front then moved south. In the province of Pisa, firefighters were repeatedly required to intervene on Sunday due to flooding and landslides. Heavy rainfall was also reported from Rome.
